Class FollowPathState

java.lang.Object
de.gurkenlabs.litiengine.entities.behavior.State
de.gurkenlabs.litiengine.entities.behavior.EntityState<de.gurkenlabs.litiengine.entities.Creature>
ca.sfu.cmpt276.fall2025.team14.utils.FollowPathState
public class FollowPathState extends de.gurkenlabs.litiengine.entities.behavior.EntityState<de.gurkenlabs.litiengine.entities.Creature>
Represents a custom entity state that moves a Creature along a predefined path. The state uses an EntityNavigator to control navigation and continuously restarts the path when the end is reached.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • FollowPathState

      public FollowPathState(de.gurkenlabs.litiengine.entities.Creature entity, Path2D path, List<Point2D> points)
      Constructs a new FollowPathState for the given creature and path. The provided points are appended to the path in the order given.
      Parameters:
      entity - the creature that will follow the path
      path - the initial Path2D for navigation
      points - the list of points to extend the path with

  • Method Details

    • perform

      public void perform()
      Executes the state's behavior. If navigation has not started, the navigator begins moving along the path. When the path completes, navigation restarts from the beginning.
      Specified by:
      perform in class de.gurkenlabs.litiengine.entities.behavior.State

    • getNavigator

      public de.gurkenlabs.litiengine.entities.behavior.EntityNavigator getNavigator()
      Returns the EntityNavigator used to move the creature along the path.
      Returns:
      the navigator controlling movement
